utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've just had a real like a real bad cough. Umm, it's been going on for 4 or 5 days now umm, and I'm just, I'm having some trouble breathing. I'm coughing up like gunky green stuff. Uhm, yeah, it's just really bad. I haven't had anything like this before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so when did the cough start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: About four or five days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Four or five days ago. OK, and, uhm OK. So for 5 days, did you do have any shortness of breath with that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's uh, I'm just I feel like I can't, can't quite like breathe fully.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm you can't quite breathe fully, so like when you take a deep breath in, you can't expand your lungs fully. Is that what you mean?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, I just overall I just feel like yeah, I'm I'm short of breath. I guess that's the best way to put it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're short of breath. And how about wheezing? Do you have any of that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So when did this start again? You said if a couple days ago or a few weeks ago.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think it was four days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Four days ago, OK, and did you have like a runny nose or stuffy nose at that point?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe a little bit. I wasn't really thinking about it too much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not a sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Not a sore throat, OK. Uhm, how about changes in your taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, none of those.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Fever, weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I feel like I've I've probably had a fever the last couple nights. I've just been really hot in the evenings.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I feel like I've had a fever. I don't know bout my weight. I don't weigh myself all the time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But nothing like major.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Feels a little like it hurts a little bit, like when I when I breathe in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, do you ever feel like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, And any changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, that's all the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No bellyaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No bellyaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about changes to your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any dizziness or confusion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, uh no, not dizziness or confusion, but I have just been feeling very weak and tired.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When you say weak, have you like lost any of your like motor movements like your arms, legs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, not like that kind of weak. I just have felt like very rundown.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just like just fatigued like more than usual, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you otherwise healthy or do you have any longstanding medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I don't I don't have too much luckily, knock on wood. Uhm, I, I take a medication for my reflux.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: And I did, I did have a knee replacement, five years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Other than that, like I don't, I haven't really been to the doctor for much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm alright. Do you have something called COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Uhm, are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just that one for the reflux its uhm oh, it starts with an R. Uhm, Rabeprazole?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Including like the pneumovax vaccine and the shingrix?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I had the shingrix the pneumo I think the doctor said we were going to look at that the next time I came in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sure.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I I'm not sure I I know that I always say yes to these things, but I'm not sure because of Covid and stuff if I've been getting everything exactly on time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhmm. OK, and how about uh, how about allergies? Do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, like uh, just seasonal. Not to any medications or anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, have you been in touch with anyone sick recently around you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, like the only person I see is my husband. I guess him, and so he has a PSW that comes in to take care of him. He has a couple more problems than I do. So basically, we see I see him and her and we see we see our kids, but just like outside.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK and alright and then, uhm, have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Dietary wise, are you like eating healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, I think so. I try to, you know, cook, you know, whole foods for us like lots of veggies and you know fish and good meat. Although in the past you know few days, I just 'cause I felt really rundown and fatigued, I haven't been eating as much as I normally do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Otherwise, I think we pretty healthy I try to, you know, follow healthy recipes and find them online.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. Yeah, that's good. Do you, do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, and any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'll have the occasional glass of wine on a special occasion, but not frequently and not, not heavily.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And where do you live and who do you live with right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, just me and my husband. We live outside of town. We live in the country on a little farm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any old carpets or dust or mold or asbestos in the, in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no we renovated probably 15 years ago, and there's no no more carpet, and there were never any asbestos problems or anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, well I think those are all the questions that I had. Did you have any questions for myself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so. I just I hope you know we can get this figured out.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. So we'll start with doing a Covid swab because you have some symptoms that overlap with it, so you should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours with those results. But it does sound like what you're telling me with the wet cough and you know a little bit of shortness of breath, I think it's worthwhile to get a chest x-ray to see if you might possibly have a pneumonia, and if you do, if there is some consolidation we'll probably prescribe some antibiotics for that. Umm, how does that sound to you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sounds great to me. Yeah, I just you know, hope there's nothing serious going on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, and it shouldn't be. It's probably 1 something that's been going around in the community and you haven't had any recent hospitalizations or surgery, so I wouldn't worry about like any of those atypical bugs just yet.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, OK, that's good to hear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. Well, uhm, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
